title: LME Week base metals: Challenges and opportunities
summary: Aluminum prices have seen fluctuations with premiums rising in certain regions. The European aluminum P1020A premium increased to $250-280 per tonne in Rotterdam. Market participants are closely watching trade talks between the US and Canada, which could impact tariffs and prices.

title: Daily Aluminum price, LME Comex Shfe Price of Aluminum live
summary: SMM reports current aluminum prices with the SMM A00 Aluminum Ingot priced between $2,595.78 and $2,600.73 per metric ton. Premiums for aluminum in various regions remain stable, with Yangshan Aluminum Premium at $90 per metric ton. Expectations for US Fed interest rate cuts are influencing market dynamics.

title: Steel and aluminum tariffs drive up costs for everyday fasteners
summary: Tariffs on steel and aluminum are significantly increasing costs for fasteners like screws and bolts, impacting construction and consumer goods. These tariffs have led to price hikes of 30-50% for some items, affecting both distributors and consumers. The broader economic impact includes delayed projects and higher consumer prices.

title: Major Fire at US Aluminum Plant Exposes Supply Chain Weak Link
summary: A major fire at an American aluminum plant highlights vulnerabilities in the supply chain. The US aluminum production is only 670,000 tons, less than 1% of the global total, heavily overshadowed by China which leads with 43.385 million tons, accounting for over 60% of global production.

title: Small Fire breaks out inside Novelis plant late Thursday night
summary: A small debris fire occurred at the Novelis aluminum plant in Scriba, New York, shortly after midnight on October 10. This follows a major fire on September 16 that severely damaged the same facility, halting production and impacting the automotive industry, especially Ford's vehicle production.

title: Ford Faces $1B Earnings Blow After Aluminum Plant Fire Halts F-150 Production
summary: The September 16 fire at Novelis’ Oswego aluminum plant disrupted nearly 40% of the U.S. auto industry's aluminum sheet supply, potentially costing Ford up to $1 billion in lost earnings. The plant's prolonged downtime threatens production of Ford's F-150 and Super Duty trucks through early 2026.

title: Fire at aluminium plant to hit Ford's bottom line by up to USD 1 billion
summary: The September 16 fire at Novelis' New York aluminum plant is expected to disrupt aluminum supply for Ford's F-150 production through the end of the year, with analysts warning of up to a $1 billion impact on Ford's earnings.

title: LME Week base metals: Challenges and opportunities
summary: The US's 50% tariff on aluminum imports from Canada has shifted Canadian aluminum exports toward Europe, increasing European imports significantly in June and July 2025. Discussions continue on potential trade deals that could reduce tariffs and affect premiums, while weak demand in China and global economic slowdown pose challenges for aluminum markets.

title: Alcoa Targets Net-Zero Aluminum Processing Operations
summary: Alcoa Corporation announced a commitment to reach net-zero emissions in its global aluminum operations by 2050, aiming for a 30% emissions reduction by 2025 and 50% by 2030 compared to 2015. The company is developing innovative technologies such as zero-carbon smelting and mechanical vapor recompression to eliminate greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum processing, with carbon-free aluminum already used by companies like Apple and Audi.

title: Weekly Recap: Aluminium's low-carbon revolution in action
summary: The global aluminum industry is advancing sustainability through innovations like RUSAL's electrochemical technology converting off-grade scrap into high-purity metal and Egypt's Dandara Solar Energy project supplying renewable power to Egypt Aluminium, reducing emissions by 30%. Additionally, Taural India is implementing low-carbon casting techniques that could cut emissions by up to 80%, supporting eco-friendly production across multiple sectors.

title: Critical Threats Facing the Global Aluminium Industry
summary: Emerging technologies such as inert anode technology promise to reduce aluminum smelting CO₂ emissions by 60-85% by replacing carbon anodes with inert materials. Renewable energy integration and advanced recycling technologies using AI for high-purity sorting are also key innovations driving sustainability, enabling significant emission reductions and promoting circular economy practices in the aluminum sector.

title: Century Aluminum's sustainability blueprint for a carbon-free tomorrow
summary: Century Aluminum is advancing sustainability through low-carbon aluminum production, securing ISO 14001, ISO 45001, and ISO 9001 certifications, and improving transparency by integrating global sustainability reporting frameworks. The company focuses on responsible production, innovation, and environmental stewardship to reduce its carbon footprint and enhance operational efficiency.

title: HRC Steel Falls to 811.06 USD/T, Down 0.48% from Previous Day
summary: HRC steel prices dropped to 811.06 USD per tonne on October 10, 2025, marking a 0.48% decrease from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have seen a modest 0.13% increase, but remain near their lowest levels since February 2025.

title: MMI Daily Iron Ore Index Report October 10 2025
summary: The most-traded iron ore contract (I2601) closed at 795, up 1.02% from the previous day, as traders adjusted positions in line with market conditions. The report highlights ongoing activity among steel mills and traders in response to current market dynamics.

title: Delayed Publication of Flat Steel Reduced Carbon Emissions Inferred Price
summary: Fastmarkets announced a delay in the publication of its flat steel reduced carbon emissions price assessment for China, now scheduled for October 17. The previous assessment ranged from 3,360 to 3,870 yuan per tonne.

title: 2025 Ministerial Meeting of the Global Forum on Steel Excess Capacity
summary: The OECD is hosting a ministerial meeting of the Global Forum on Steel Excess Capacity in Gqeberha, South Africa, focusing on global steel capacity issues. The meeting is scheduled for October 10, 2025, from 07:00 to 09:00.

title: AISI Applauds USTR Leadership At Global Steel Forum
summary: Kevin Dempsey, president and CEO of AISI, praised the U.S. Trade Representative's leadership at a global steel forum, highlighting the importance of U.S. engagement in international steel discussions.

title: STEEL TECH - International Seminar '25
summary: The STEEL TECH International Seminar 2025 in Kolkata, India, focuses on integrating AI and advanced technologies to enhance efficiency and sustainability in steel production. Praveen Chaturvedi from Tenova Technologies presented a paper on 'Intelligent EAF,' an expert technology aimed at maximizing furnace process efficiency.

title: BIR warns that a proposed regulation could lay groundwork for trade limitations on ferrous scrap
summary: The Bureau of International Recycling (BIR) highlights concerns over a new EU regulation aimed at protecting the steel industry from global overcapacity. The regulation could impact investments in green steel projects, threatening the EU's decarbonization goals and risking job losses in the steel sector.

title: Needle Coke Market Forecasts 2025-2030: Key Drivers Include Asia-Pacific's Dominance, Particularly China's Steel and EV Sectors
summary: The global shift toward electric arc furnace (EAF) steelmaking, driven by stricter environmental regulations, is increasing demand for needle coke, a critical raw material for graphite electrodes. This trend supports sustainability by reducing carbon emissions in steel production, with significant growth expected in China and other Asia-Pacific regions.

title: Fortune Global 500 Steelmaker Shagang Group Celebrates 50 Years of Growth and Innovation
summary: Shagang Group emphasizes its commitment to becoming a world-class steel enterprise by focusing on profitability, efficiency, talent development, and sustainability. The company is advancing its transformation toward high-end, smart, and sustainable steelmaking through innovation and environmental responsibility.

title: MSCI Announces Annual Safety Innovation and Culture Improvement Award Winners
summary: MSCI honored Metallus, Steel Services, Inc., and Worthington Steel with its annual Safety Innovation and Culture Improvement awards, recognizing advancements in safety practices within the steel industry.

title: Copper fell to 4.87 USD/Lbs on October 10, 2025, down 4.80% from the previous day
summary: Copper prices dropped to $4.87 per pound on October 10, 2025, marking a 4.80% decline from the previous day. Despite the recent fall, copper prices have risen 5.58% over the past month and are up 9.37% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect copper to trade at $5.18 per pound by the end of the quarter and $5.66 in 12 months.

title: Comex Copper Ends the Week 4.14% Lower at $4.8485 — Data Talk
summary: Comex copper prices for October delivery fell 4.14% to $4.8485 per pound this week, the largest weekly decline since early August 2025. The price also dropped 4.47% on the day, marking the largest one-day decline since July 31, 2025. Copper is currently down 16.33% from its 52-week high of $5.795 but remains up 21.64% from its 52-week low.

title: Copper Near 10-Week High on Supply Concerns
summary: Copper futures slipped below $5.1 per pound amid profit-taking but stayed near ten-week highs due to supply disruptions in Chile and Indonesia. Chile's state miner Codelco reported its lowest monthly output in over two decades following a fatal accident that halted operations. Indonesia's Grasberg mine also faces limited output after a recent fatal accident, with full capacity not expected until early 2027.

title: After a rally to $11,000/t, copper prices fall on the back of profit-taking
summary: Copper prices fell on October 10, 2025, as investors took profits following a rally to a 16-month high of $11,000 per tonne the previous session. The decline reflects typical market corrections after sharp price increases.

title: Copper Near 10-Week High on Supply Concerns
summary: Copper futures remain near ten-week highs despite a slight slip due to profit-taking, driven by ongoing mine disruptions in Chile and Indonesia that are tightening global supply. Chile's state miner Codelco reported its lowest monthly output in over 20 years for August, and Indonesia’s Grasberg mine is operating below capacity after a fatal accident. Additionally, Canada's Teck Resources lowered its annual production outlook.

title: Gold Higher Following a Historic Week
summary: The International Copper Study Group forecasts refined copper production to rise by 3.4% in 2025 but slow to 0.9% growth in 2026. Due to several mine disruptions, the group now expects a smaller surplus of refined copper in 2025 and a deficit in 2026, revising previous forecasts downward. Refined copper usage is also expected to increase moderately in both years.

title: Eroding trust in US dollar behind gold, silver and copper price rally, says TD Securities
summary: Copper prices have surged toward $11,000 a tonne amid a broader rally in hard assets driven by declining confidence in the US dollar as a store of value. TD Securities highlights that this loss of trust in the dollar is fueling strong commodity price increases, including copper, as investors seek real assets. The rally is notable for being driven primarily by Western markets rather than traditional buyers like China.

title: Gold, Silver & Copper: tech and sustainability trends
summary: Copper companies are addressing long-term supply challenges by boosting production, adopting sustainability practices, and leveraging digital innovations such as AI and satellite technology. They are also enhancing recovery rates through advanced mineral processing and bioleaching, while integrating recycling to optimize copper supply sustainability.

title: Copper Smelting Companies & Gold Mining: 2025 Trends
summary: Copper smelting companies are advancing through automation, AI-driven monitoring, blockchain traceability, and satellite-based fleet management to improve efficiency and sustainability. Innovations include cleaner sulfur recovery, water recycling, tailings reprocessing, and carbon footprint tracking, all supporting environmental management and regulatory compliance.

title: TNR Gold NSR Royalty Update – Los Azules Feasibility Study Confirms Economically Robust Copper Project With Leading ESG Performance
summary: The Los Azules copper project in Argentina is confirmed as a long-life, low-cost producer with strong economic returns and sustainability credentials. The project advances toward construction readiness with a design that reduces environmental footprint and aligns with the global energy transition toward a low-carbon future.

title: Chemetall launches first global chromium- and fluoride-free passivation solution for copper foils
summary: BASF's Chemetall introduced Gardolene D, a chromium- and fluoride-free passivation solution for copper foils that enhances battery performance and sustainability. This innovation supports improved electrode conductivity and helps manufacturers meet evolving regulatory and sustainability requirements in the energy storage sector.

title: Anglo American moving forward with SandLix™ heap leach innovation
summary: Anglo American is advancing the SandLix™ heap leach process, which has the potential to reduce the cut-off grade for copper extraction by up to 20%, improving resource efficiency and sustainability in copper mining operations.

title: Nickel Hits 4-week Low
summary: Nickel prices decreased to 15,151 USD per ton, marking the lowest level since September 2025. Over the past four weeks, nickel prices have fallen by 0.43%, and over the last 12 months, prices have dropped by 15.33%.

title: SMM #1 Refined Nickel Price on October 10
summary: On October 10, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged between 122,400 and 125,300 yuan per metric ton, with an average price of 123,850 yuan/mt, which is an increase of 250 yuan/mt from the previous day.

title: Centaurus Metals Secures Mining Lease for Jaguar Nickel Project
summary: Centaurus Metals has been granted the Mining Lease for its Jaguar Nickel Sulphide Project in northern Brazil. This approval allows the company to mine ore from the project's deposits for commercial purposes. Centaurus is now progressing strategic partnering and off-take discussions to secure project financing.

title: SMM Update: High-Grade NPI Prices Under Pressure with Limited Downside
summary: Nickel prices have fluctuated significantly, with domestic inventory seeing a substantial buildup. The market dynamics are influenced by supply and demand factors, impacting high-grade nickel pig iron (NPI) prices.

title: NexMetals Announces Continuance into British Columbia
summary: NexMetals Mining Corp. has continued out of Ontario into British Columbia under the Business Corporations Act. The company focuses on the redevelopment of copper, nickel, and cobalt resources in Botswana.

title: Eagle Mine and Allonnia: Nickel Purification Breakthrough 2025
summary: Eagle Mine and Allonnia have developed D-Solve technology that reduces nickel impurities by 40% and increases concentrate grade by 18%. This biological purification method enhances resource utilization, reduces waste, lowers processing intensity, and supports circular mineral processing, aligning with sustainability and economic goals in nickel mining.

title: Environmental Engineering Researchers are Using Plants to Extract Nickel
summary: Researchers at Stevens are exploring phytomining, using hyperaccumulator plants to extract nickel from ultramafic mine tailings and serpentine soils. This approach offers a cleaner, sustainable alternative to traditional mining by recovering nickel while remediating contaminated soils, potentially benefiting clean energy material supply chains.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French startup Genomines secured $45 million to scale its phytoextraction technology, which uses hyperaccumulator plants to extract nickel from low-grade soils. Their nickel concentrate is significantly richer than traditional mining outputs, and the process promises faster deployment, lower costs, and reduced environmental impact compared to conventional mining.

title: Nornickel's 2025 Nickel Target: Will Production Hit New Highs?
summary: Nornickel is advancing sustainability in nickel production through its Sulfur Program 2.0 and cleaner energy use, achieving one of the lowest carbon footprints in mining. The company collaborates with scientific institutions to assess climate risks and reduce greenhouse gas emissions across its operations, aiming to balance production growth with environmental responsibility.

title: Greening nickel extraction requires institutional and financial support
summary: A promising low-carbon nickel extraction technology has been highlighted, but scaling it to reduce the industry's carbon footprint requires overcoming institutional and financial barriers. The article emphasizes the environmental impact of nickel mining, especially from forest clearing, and the need for systemic support to adopt greener methods.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Constructs Photovoltaic Plants
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali is involved in a project to construct four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily, enhancing its energy performance and reducing environmental impact. This aligns with its partnership with CVA to support regional decarbonization targets. The project contributes to the competitiveness of the local steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Finalizes Mannesmann Tubes Acquisition
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has finalized the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from Salzgitter, expanding its footprint in the seamless tube market. The acquisition aims to enhance Cogne's competitiveness in the stainless steel and nickel alloy sectors.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Launches Green Hydrogen Pilot Plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, Italy. This initiative is part of the company's efforts to innovate and reduce its environmental impact.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris Completes $85 Million Exhaust System Upgrade
summary: Tenaris has completed an $85 million exhaust system upgrade at its steel mill in Koppel, Pennsylvania. The new system aims to improve air quality by more effectively collecting and separating dust and particulates. This investment is part of a broader $140 million upgrade since 2020.

title: Tenaris Celebrates 25 Years of Seamless Pipe Production in Canada
summary: Tenaris marked 25 years of seamless pipe production in Canada, highlighting its role in supporting the energy industry. The company has expanded its capabilities with both seamless and electric resistance welded (ERW) pipe manufacturing. This milestone underscores Tenaris's commitment to industrial growth.

title: Exane BNP Favors Vallourec Over Tenaris
summary: Exane BNP Paribas prefers Vallourec over Tenaris due to a weaker price environment for oil country tubular goods (OCTG). It downgraded Tenaris's rating to 'neutral' while maintaining 'outperform' for Vallourec. The decision reflects Vallourec's diversified market exposure.

title: Tenaris Shareholder Update on Ownership Stake and Planned Share Sales
summary: Tenaris's controlling shareholders plan to sell shares while maintaining at least a 67% ownership stake. This decision is in response to Tenaris's ongoing share repurchase program. The move aims to stabilize long-term investment in the company.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority has opened an investigation into major low voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl, for allegedly fixing prices since 2005. The probe follows a clemency request from one of the companies, leading to inspections at company offices and distributors.

title: Prysmian Secures €460m Contract For Italy–Tunisia Subsea Power Link
summary: Prysmian has won a €460 million contract to build a submarine power cable connecting Italy and Tunisia. This project highlights Prysmian's continued leadership in subsea cable infrastructure.
